However, the conclusion adds an additional condition (the computer catching on fire) and still claims that playing video games is possible. 

In logic, adding a new condition to the premise should not affect the validity of the conclusion if the original condition is still present. However, in this case, the added condition (the computer catching on fire) is likely to make it impossible to play video games, as a computer is typically required to play video games.
